shipbuilding and offshore industry while taking preemptive actions amid the fast changing business environment.
Lastly, the company pledges to stay open to the valued feedbacks from shareholders and stakeholders
and to grow into an eco-friendly and sustainable company.

Samsung Heavy Industries (hereinafter referred to as SHI), which has successfully executed various
projects in shipbuilding and offshore fields since its foundation in 1974, consistently endeavors
to reflect the voices of its stakeholders, including clients, subcontractors, employees, and local
communities. Moreover, as a global industry leader, SHI is investing much effort in building
reliable and eco-friendly ships and offshore production facilities.
2015 has been by far the most difficult business year for SHI due to significant challenges, such as
the global economic recession, low oil prices, and a series of trials & errors in executing offshore
projects. Despite such difficult conditions, however, SHI employees endeavored to maintain safety
and quality as well as comply with delivery schedule by showing concerted commitment and
dedication, thereby transforming the crisis into opportunities.
Not only has SHI promoted the importance of safety awareness by announcing January 19th as
the official Safety Awareness Day, but it has also received the highest level of recognition in the
Safety Assessment Evaluation, conducted by ExxonMobil, for 6 consecutive years. Moreover, SHI
significantly improved quality by enforcing its 10 Quality Rule Implementation Check on a weekly
basis for flawless delivery. In the meantime, the Production Sector has succeeded in utilizing the
Dual Lifting Method, which enables a 8,000 tons and a 3,600 tons floating cranes to lift and load a
11,600 tons terra block, thereby enhancing the overall production efficiency.
SHI acutely realizes that the company¡¯s survival depends on the commitment of its employees and
is firmly determined to overcome the current crisis. The company plans to set this experience as
a valuable stepping stone for greater progress in the future. Waiting for the optimal time to arrive,
SHI will not only stay committed to basics, but also try to attain fundamental competitiveness
required to effectively respond to any harsh external environment. In closing, SHI sincerely asks
for the unwavering support and trust of its stakeholders.
Thank you.

I am pleased to report on Samsung Life¡¯s creative changes and innovation efforts as we continue to overcome substantial
obstacles on our way to emerging as more than just Korea¡¯s top insurer, but one of the world¡¯s most respected global companies.
Over the past half century, Samsung Life has honored its promise to firmly secure the happiness of individuals, their families
and society as a whole. We have also sustained tremendous growth while solidifying our foundation as a company with
deep, long-lasting roots. In 2012, we strategically addressed rapidly changing business environments with a clear notion
of our business concept and our 2020 Long-Term Vision. At the same time, we strengthened all of our customer-oriented,
down-to-earth management practices. In addition, we proactively engaged in initiatives to give back to society and green
management practices as we faithfully carried out our business philosophy, which entails caring greatly for everyone.
In 2013, Samsung Life is embracing change and innovation as we overcome every challenge on our way to become a highly
respected global company. The path on which we find ourselves to accomplish this requires the support and collaboration
of all our stakeholders. To that effect, we have set the following four goals to maintain the trust and support of our stakeholders.
Increasing creative changes and innovation in meeting challenges
We clearly understand that any company which is content with its past success will eventually be left behind. In 2013, the
business environment is particularly formidable for everyone, especially for the insurance business, which faces great challenges
in maintaining sustainable growth due to the global economic slowdown and the Korean government¡¯s ultra-low interest
rate policy. To preemptively address these issues, Samsung Life has established an innovative process of brainstorming
and implementing new ideas to embrace creative changes and innovation. At Samsung Life, we define our business
concept as one that supports our customers to care for their loved ones in our effort to ensure financial security for a better
society. Applying this concept to the entire value chain, from creation and selling of insurance products to policy administration
and claims payments, we are committed to delivering the highest value in the insurance business. At the same time,
we are beginning a new innovation drive in 2013, working on a future-oriented work process system, and an Enterprise Resources
Planning (ERP) system to incorporate a more innovative work process into the organization. We will also continue to
operate Speed Management and Synergy Management systems for greater efficiency in the decision-making process and
subsequent implementation.Remaining a CUSTOMER-oriented company
Samsung Life is well aware that customers represent the foundation of all companies, and just as with any other company,
our own customers are always keeping a close eye on our every move. Thus, customer value is at the center of everything
we do, from providing differentiated products and services to marketing activities. While developing products that best serve
the needs of our customers and symbolize our commitment to bettering society, we are establishing a customer-oriented
process that spans everything from policy underwriting to claims payments. For instance, we have raised the rate of claims
payments on the same date they are filed by customers from 20 percent to 52 percent. By the end of 2013, we plan to raise
this figure to 80 percent. In recognition of such customer-oriented business practices the National Customer Satisfaction
Index (NCSI) ranked Samsung Life the top Korean insurer for the ninth straight year in 2012. With the unwavering belief that
customer-oriented management practices will eventually benefit the company in the long run, we will continue to further
strengthen our customer-oriented management practices.
Promoting respect for people within the organization
Samsung Life firmly believes that people constitute a company¡¯s real competitiveness, which is why we feel that our employees
are Samsung Life¡¯s most valuable asset. As a result, we are constantly offering the brightest men and women from
all fields with high-level education programs to foster them as next-generation leaders. Furthermore, we are promoting a
more communicative corporate culture throughout the company, one which puts a premium on respecting others, while
maintaining highly productive workplaces where employees enjoy coming to work every day with a sense of pride in their
company. Open and honest communication will ensure that everybody at Samsung Life carries out the company¡¯s business
concept precisely and just as it was meant to be fulfilled.
Strengthening green management and a culture of sharing in management practices
Samsung Life greatly values the importance of trust-based relationships within society. That is just part of the reason why
we practice green management and never forget to give back to society, as we are consistently building higher levels of
trust with society at large. While communicating and contributing to society, we aim to become a company that is not only
admired by customers and the nation as a whole, but one which assists in the development of society and, ultimately, the
country. An example of this commitment is Samsung Life¡¯s Sesalmaul program¡ªa community-based movement and research
center for infants, toddlers and families¡ªwhich addresses social issues related to Korea¡¯s low birth rate. Another example
is the Serotonin Drum Club program, which helps adolescents grow up to become hardworking adults who contribute to
society. More recently, we launched Samsung Life¡¯s Bridge of Life project to reduce the nation¡¯s suicide rate and took part
in a Purple Ribbon campaign to fight women¡¯s cancers. As a responsible member of the global community, we also supply
rehabilitation devices to the disabled and provide numerous educational materials through our overseas operations in China,
Thailand and Vietnam. To protect the environment and raise corporate value, we also have in place various green management
practices. While internalizing green management practices into the day-to-day lives of our employees, both at work
and at home, we also contribute to building a green society through our green finance products and services.
As a result of our indefatigable efforts to become a highly respected global company, we were the first Korean insurer to be
listed on the DJSI World index in 2012. This confirms our status as one of the world¡¯s top 14?and one of Asia¡¯s top 3?insurers
when it comes to sustainability management. Although we take pride in this achievement, we will not stop working
hard as we continue to strengthen our foundation for sustainable growth.
Every employee and consultant at Samsung Life puts customers, society and the country before anything else in all of our
business activities as we understand that the company can only prosper when our customers and society are prosperous as
a whole.
As a responsible corporate citizen, we take pride in giving back to society and creating new social values that can benefit
others.
I hope that of our stakeholders will accept my sincere gratitude when I thank them and ask for their continued support of
Samsung Life as we move forward.
Thank you.

¡°Nurturing People with Greater Love to Build Better Financial Security¡± This is the commitment we make for our CUSTOMERS by providing our insurance plans. Dear stakeholders, I am pleased to report on the sustainability management of Samsung Life¡¯s activities as we strive to become one of the world¡¯s most respected global companies. Over the past half century, based on our strong sense of duty to provide insurance for our customers, Samsung Life has emerged as Korea¡¯s top insurer. However, as the past success does not equal future success, it is not easy for a company to sustain growth for more than 100 years. The continued economic downturn and low interest rates in 2014 sent warning signals to the financial sector, which intensified the competition for survival. Therefore, Samsung Life has strived to increase sales and strengthen profits, by setting clear goals under its goal of ¡®achieving qualitative growth through CUSTOMER oriented practices¡¯. As a result, Samsung Life made outstanding achievements that reinforced its position in protection-type products and improved new business margin, while also increased profits in spite of low interest rates. In order to respond proactively to paradigm changes in the insurance industry, such as low interest rates, low growth and aging population, to achieve qualitative growth, we have systematically reformed our platforms for management, including organizations, systems and work processes. Due to these efforts, Samsung Life became the first Korean insurer to be named on the world¡¯s most renowned sustainability list, the Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) World, for three consecutive years. Although we take pride in these achievements, we will not stay content as we aim to become a highly respected global company by continuously undergoing innovations to meet challenges and achieve qualitative growth by maximizing corporate values. To achieve this, we will implement three core tasks this year as follows: Accelerating CUSTOMER and market-oriented qualitative growth Samsung Life will further accelerate the qualitative growth to respond to future challenges with innovations. In order to overcome the current difficult conditions and accelerate qualitative growth, we will transform all of our strategies and work processes to be CUSTOMER and market-oriented ones. Also, we will improve the competitiveness of our sales channel by innovating the development system for our FCs, while also developing unique competitiveness with differentiated business model in high growth markets, such as retirees and the affluent, and bring the globalization of asset management. Maximizing the corporate value through profits Samsung Life will further reinforce its profit and improved corporate values. In 2014, we will increase the sales of protectiontype products and improve new business values of other products, while also strengthen our profit base through continuous improvement of cost competitiveness. In addition, we will ensure prompt payment of premiums and prevent any unfair practices like insurance accidents, to protect the rights of our customers and shareholders and promote sound insurance business practices. Establishing field-oriented and performanceoriented corporate culture Samsung Life firmly believes that strategies should be implemented on site with our customers, while it is the most important means of making performances by focusing on meeting our goals. We will strive to further increase our performances, including reinforcing management practices to improve the competitiveness and execution in the field and establish performance-oriented corporate culture by getting rid of inefficient practices. Dear stakeholders, Along with the uncertainty of financial markets at home and abroad, the continuity of low interest rates and slow growth in the insurance market further weakened the market with prolonged period of low interest rates and low growth, which will bring intensified competition with other business areas due to financial convergence and the development of IT technologies. However, all of the employees at Samsung Life consider these situations is an opportunity and strive to become a highly respected global insurer as Korea¡¯s no.1 insurer. As a responsible corporate citizen, we will faithfully fulfill our role by giving back to our customers and the society. I hope that our stakeholders will continue to show their full support for Samsung Life in the future as we aim to become a highly respected insurer with high values for sustainable growth. Once again, I would like to extend my sincere gratitude to all of the stakeholders who have supported Samsung Life. Thank you.
April 2015
President & CEO Chang-soo Kim

I am pleased to report on the sustainability management of
Samsung Life¡¯s activities as we strive to become one of the
world¡¯s most respected global companies.
Uncertainty continued to dominate the global economy throughout
2015. The contributing factors included substantially growing risks
in China and economic crises in some major emerging economies.
Korea was no exception. Its growth potential weakened in 2015
due to low economic growth and interest rates coupled with rapid
population aging and a continuing slowdown in consumption.
The financial services sector had a difficult year. The onset of
the lowest interest rates in the country's history threatened the
financial stability of the industry. Against all odds, Samsung Life
made significant progress in 2015. It further consolidated its
market dominance in the field of protection insurance. It managed
to mitigate losses from low interest rates. Those are the results
of the company's best efforts to pursue quality growth through
expansion of its protection insurance sales and make its financial
structure as robust as possible under the vision of ¡®maximizing
corporate value.¡¯ Moreover, Samsung Life made considerable
progress in 2015 with its thorough preparations for innovations
in its management platform and the company's all out efforts to
achieve quality growth, in an effort to proactively cope with the
paradigm shift being made in the Korean insurance industry due
to the country's sustained period of low economic growth, low
interest rates and rapidly-aging society.
Due to these efforts, Samsung Life became the first Korean
insurer to be named on the world¡¯s most renowned sustainability
index, the Dow Jones Sustainability Indices(DJSI) World, for four
consecutive years. Samsung Life will not become complacent
with its performance in 2015. It will do its utmost in 2016 to
further accelerate its drive for ¡®value-centric management¡¯ that the
company has promoted during the past two years on the basis
of its customer-oriented business management, which advocates
placing utmost priority on customers as its backbone and starting
all over again from their perspectives. Through its ¡®quality growth¡¯,
Samsung Life desires to maximize customer values and achieve
quality growth at the same time.
All of us at Samsung Life are deeply aware of the reality that
businesses must continue to be chosen by customers in order
to survive and thrive. In 2016, the company will further evolve
its drive for customer-centric business management and quality
growth. In an effort to expand its base for continuous growth
in the future, Samsung Life will make significant progress in its
efforts to increase its market dominance in the areas of wealth,
pension and asset management.
Stabilization of Quality and Value-Centric Management
In 2016, Samsung Life will stabilize its value-centric management
and create performance results based on its outstanding quality of
management. Samsung Life will continue to make its best efforts
to produce robust performance results in 2016. To do that, it will
promote ¡®Quality growth in 3 Major Areas¡¯ including balanced
product sales, expansion of robust sales organizations, and the
enhancement of fundamentals. On the basis of the positive results
of ¡°quality growth¡±, Samsung Life will realize a virtuous cycle
of profit-making and corporate growth throughout its business
activities in 2016.
Accelerating the Implementation of Management
Innovation Activities
In the area of insurance sales, Samsung Life will stabilize its
long-term consultant education programs. Also, we will make
considerable improvements in the expansion of differentiated
agency models according to the characters of consultants,
therefore developing a more efficient sales channel. In the field
of loss assessment and claim payments, Samsung Life will place
top priority on the protection of its customers' values through
the simplification of the payment process and the prevention
of insurance fraud to stabilize a healthy insurance culture in the
country. Through the company-wide implementation of enterprise
resource planning(ERP), Samsung Life will make innovations in its
overall work procedures and methods to be on par with the worldclass
business management structure and organization adopted
by global peers in the industry. In the fields of asset management
and overseas business, Samsung Life will accelerate its thorough
preparations while boosting its power of implementation with the
view to expanding its growth potential in the future.
Establishing Field-oriented and Dynamic Corporate Culture
We are well aware that our competitiveness originates from
the outstanding performance at our operating sites where our
employees come into direct contact with our customers. The
management of Samsung Life will do everything they can to
support staff working in the company's field offices by looking at
everything from their perspective so that Samsung Life personnel
on the frontlines can fulfill their potential and concentrate their
resources on their performance more intently. In an effort to
cultivate a dynamic organizational culture company-wide,
Samsung Life will foster a work culture where members are
able to excel solely based on their work and performance; a
healthy culture where members compete and become evaluated
fairly; and a sales culture where the spirit of infinite challenge is
treasured.
Dear Stakeholders,
The domestic and global business environment is anticipated
to face further difficulties in 2016 as well. Globally, economic
uncertainty keeps growing. Domestically, seismic changes are
predicted in the competitive landscape of the financial services
industry in connection with the convergence of financial services
and ICT solutions, coupled with the ongoing massive reforms in
the country's financial services sector.
However, all the employees of Samsung Life, including myself,
have accepted this reality as opportunities for us to make further
corporate growth. We are making earnest efforts to enhance our
fundamental, differentiated competitiveness in diverse areas in
2016. Needless to say, Samsung Life engages itself in a variety
of activities that it feels obligated to carry out for the benefit of the
community it belongs to as a responsible corporate citizen and
as a way of returning the favors it has received from its members.
I will be looking forward to your continued interest in the path
that Samsung Life takes in order to grow into ¡®a leading global
company equipped with high values¡¯ through quality growth.
Once again, I would like to extend my sincere gratitude to all the
stakeholders who have supported Samsung Life. Thank you.

Stakeholders of Samsung SDI across the world,
I deeply appreciate your unwavering support for Samsung SDI.
The year 2012 witnessed numerous difficulties and challenges posed
by the global economic downturn and the subsequent recession, with
the global economy reeling from both the financial crises in the US and
Europe as well as the sluggish growth of emerging markets. Despite the
rapidly changing business environment, however, Samsung SDI perceived
the wind of change as an opportunity and responded to it in
a proactive manner, based on innovations that stayed ahead of these
changes with an indomitable spirit of challenge.
In May 2012, to commemorate the 42nd anniversary of its founding,
Samsung SDI redefined the concept of its business as ¡°an eco-friendly
and electrochemical convergence energy industry.¡± This new business
concept is in line with our vision of delivering ¡°Smart Solution for a Green
World¡± and incorporates the ever-evolving business landscape, industry
outlook, and our blueprint for the future. That is, moving away from the
traditional energy industry, we picture a whole new industry that creates
clean energy through electricity generation and accumulation and
delivers a total solution that enables the use of this energy without any
time or spatial restraints. This concept also reflects Samsung SDI¡¯s will
to lay the foundation to become a leading global energy company and
contribute to an eco-friendly way of life on Earth for mankind.
Samsung SDI realigned its business portfolio based on its new business
concept and is accelerating its efforts to become an eco-friendly energy
solution company, with the rechargeable battery-driven energy business
accounting for 59% of its 2012 revenue. We also consolidated our
position as the leader in the small-size battery market for three consecutive
years, further outpacing our competitors in terms of market share,
and laid the groundwork for creating synergies with our existing battery
businesses and independent management in the car battery market by
acquiring all of the shares of SB LiMotive. Samsung SDI¡¯s competitiveness
in the energy storage system (ESS) sector has also been enhanced as our
clientele expanded to include not only Nichicon (Japan) but also KACO
(Germany), Xtreme Power (US), and Shinhan Bank (Korea).
At the same time, we undertook various initiatives to create environmentally
and socially sustainable values. In our business, we minimized
our environmental impact throughout the lifecycle of our products and
services by introducing a system to quantify and manage the impact
that our products and plants have on the environment. We also initiated
the Global Green Partnership Project, becoming the first player in Korea¡¯s
electricity/electronics industry to forge a clean production partnership
with our overseas suppliers and enhancing our capability to comply with
environmental regulations. Furthermore, Samsung SDI accelerated its efforts
to help a law-abiding culture take root in its organization by introducing
a quantitative evaluation system for its staff¡¯s legal compliance,
while always striving to fulfill all of its roles and responsibilities as a corporate
citizen by expanding its implementation of ¡°community-based¡±
social contribution programs that are in line with its business concept.
In recognition of such sustained efforts to fulfill its social responsibility,
Samsung SDI has been selected by Dow Jones Sustainability Indexes
(DJSI) for nine consecutive years, an unprecedented feat in Korea.
We aim to maximize customer satisfaction with innovative products that
always stay one step ahead of market changes and customer needs and
to meet the trust of our shareholders and investors by creating values
that far exceed their expectations. For our suppliers, our important business
partners, we will continue to promote a mutually beneficial cooperation
as a way to enhance their competitiveness, and jointly respond
to environmental and social sustainability issues based on this partnership.
For our staff, based on our new corporate culture, Samsung SDI
will create a constructive virtuous cycle in which a more lively communication
among staff and greater focus on building individual and team
capabilities contribute to the company¡¯s sustainability. We will continue
to grow with the community we belong to, paying greater attention to
its needs and expanding our support for the socially marginalized and
the children.
Stakeholders of Samsung SDI, I ask for your enduring support and encouragement
as we continue our journey towards a sustainable future.

CEO Message
President & CEO Sang Jin Park

Let me express my heartfelt gratitude for your continuous regard and support for
Samsung SDI.
The year 2013 was a year of strenuous endeavors to overcome the global financial
crises and recover the economy. Gaining economic vitality has never been an
easy task and the prolonged low economic growth continued. Yet, in the face of
such uncertainties in the external world, Samsung SDI rose to the challenge of
overcoming these harsh business conditions through its robust drive for overall
change and innovation .
Samsung SDI solidified its position as a global No. 1 company by further distancing
itself from other competitors in the small-sized rechargeable battery market.
With the full-fledged shipment of batteries for electric vehicles, Samsung SDI¡¯s
automotive battery operations exceeded its target in winning contracts last year
and this put its automotive battery business on the right track for solid and stable
growth. In the ESS segment, Samsung SDI¡¯s share in the Japanese residential
application market rose significantly and its technology was widely recognized as
it became the 1st in the industry to obtain quality certifications in the U.S., Japan
and Germany.
Meanwhile, as major and minor safety incidents have occurred in Korean companies
and raised alertness, Samsung SDI further reinforced its safety & environment
management system. Samsung SDI integrated safety & environment groups in its
domestic plants and upgraded their status as a team under the supervision of an
executive. It also established a safety-centered organizational culture through the
realignment of wide-ranging safety environmental standards and by reinforcing
the prevention of chemical accidents. These safety initiatives were also disseminated
to suppliers.
The shared growth programs with the suppliers have been also further developed.
Samsung SDI became the 1st in the domestic electrical and electronics
industry to forge clean production partnerships with its suppliers who possess a
global presence. Furthermore, it undertook the Global Green Partnership projects
to build stronger capabilities to respond to environmental regulations.
Samsung SDI quantifiably measured and managed the environmental impact
of its products and business sites, so as to minimize its environmental footprint
throughout the entire life cycle of its products and services. The company developed
social contribution programs that are aligned with its business operations
and engaged more employees in such social-giving and talent-donation programs.
Its sustained commitment to corporate social responsibility was publicly
recognized as Samsung SDI became the 1st Korean company to be listed on the
Dow Jones Sustainability World Index for ten straight years as of 2013.
In July 2014, Samsung SDI will take on a new challenge through the merger with
Cheil Industries, a Samsung affiliate specialized in materials. Samsung SDI redefined
its strategy to build on the synergistic effects from this merger. This merger
will allow Samsung SDI to break through its limitations as a parts and system provider
and to evolve into a truly world-class company in the materials and energy
sector.
Samsung SDI vows to always strive to achieve joint-growth with its shareholders
together. Samsung SDI will continue to build capabilities for future growth, do its
utmost to deliver the greatest-possible customer satisfaction and communicate
with the local communities to pursue mutually-beneficial partnerships.
As the company takes a new leap forward towards a sustainable future, we would
like to ask for your continued interest in and support for Samsung SDI.

First and foremost, I would like to express my gratitude for your concern and support all throughout the previous year.
During the year 2014, Samsung SDI focused all efforts to establish a sustainable business structure that can grow continuously, in spite of low economic growth globally over a long period. The merger with the prev. Cheil Industries¡¯ material business unit, Samsung SDI pave the way to become the ¡®world¡¯s leading total solutions provider in materials and energy¡¯ handling a range of solutions from materials and parts to system business.
With efforts to develop next-generation technologies, Samsung SDI¡¯s small-sized Li-ion battery business was able to launch the world¡¯s first flexible battery, thereby cementing its position as the global leader. As for the medium-to-large battery business, Samsung SDI built a firm foundation to lead the market by expanding the contract with a global automobile company to supply batteries, and acquiring the battery pack business for electric vehicles from a world-class automotive supplier Magna International. The success of the electronic materials business helped the company to become Korea¡¯s first company to mass produce core material for OLED, one of the next-generation growth engines. Chemical business has focused on strengthening the competitive edge in design which helped the company win the ¡®iF Design Award¡¯ for its emotional material.
Meanwhile, Samsung SDI made various efforts to establish a safety-driven culture which is becoming more important every day. Samsung SDI reinforced safety and environment team and system, the control tower to all workplaces of businesses in and out of the country. The subject of its supervision was broadened to encompass overseas sites and stationed suppliers to strengthen the basis of safe and environment management.
Our programs to grow with our suppliers and local communities have been further developed. With technological developments and educational activities in addition to financial support, Samsung SDI strives to establish a foundation for shared growth with its first-tier suppliers as well as its second and third tier suppliers. In an effort to make a valuable world through sharing technologies and competence with local communities, Samsung SDI launched its social contribution brand ¡®wE Dream¡¯. This helps the company¡¯s business sites to closely and actively support their local communities.
In an effort to establish a fair and transparent corporate culture, Samsung SDI puts compliance management as its first business principle and carries out various activities, including customized training sessions and site inspections for its employees to develop their law-abiding spirits.
Even though it is expected that the instability of the global economy will worsen in 2015, Samsung SDI¡¯s success DNA of being the world¡¯s best in CRT & PDP and small-sized Li-ion batteries, and its successful transformation from a fabric industry to a cutting-edge material company shows the potential it possesses. While bringing out maximized synergy amongst materials and energy businesses and pursuing world-leading changes to improve the company, Samsung SDI will continue to strive to grow with shareholders, customers, suppliers, and local communities. We would like to ask for your continued interest and support for Samsung SDI as we will make every effort to fulfill your expectation. Thank you.

In FY2012, the global economic recession and volatility in the world¡¯s financial markets persisted
amid continuous financial turmoil in Europe and slow growth in China, which have domestic
stock markets to contract. A changing investment environment, including low-interest
rates and an overall aging society, decreased the number of clients looking for high-risk/highreturn
products. Consequently, the daily market trading volume, which used to hover around
KRW 9 trillion, has fallen to around KRW 6 trillion, while equity-type fund markets lost investments
of roughly KRW 8 trillion. Meanwhile, amendments to Korea¡¯s Capital Markets Act
were delayed, so financial services companies faced hurdles when preparing to start new
businesses with raised equity capital.
Samsung Securities, however, was steadfast in responding preemptively to market changes,
despite temporary profit declines. We reorganized our business structure to a more clientoriented
approach, and reacted to the changing needs of our clients, such as retirement solutions,
tax planning, and the increased preference for medium-risk/medium-return products.
We were therefore able to post net revenue of KRW 965.6 billion and net income of KRW
157.8 billion for FY2012. Such returns were enabled by stable revenue generation as we
proactively responded to the changing needs of our clients, as well as via enhanced cost efficiency
through various innovative measures, despite reduced commissions and fees amid
a slow market. Notably, our high net-worth individual (HNWI) client base and client assets
rose y-y, further solidifying our unrivaled position in the wealth management market.Under such conditions, we continued to observe the most important values of a financial company,
like client trust and integrity management, while actively contributing to society in order
to share our good fortune. Samsung Securities was named as the top securities company in
terms of complete sales of funds for three consecutive years, mainly due to the determination
of our staff to engage in ethical management. Our 131 volunteer teams conducted social activities
nationwide to meet the needs of local communities. In 2012, we established ties with
nine farming villages ? up from four in 2011 ? and opened the ¡°Dream Maru,¡± library for children
of low-income families in an effort to share with fellow citizens from all areas of society.The securities industry faces a difficult business environment amid slowing domestic growth,
a continuing stock market slump, and rising competition. Despite of this, Samsung Securities
is committed to the basic principle of ¡°The greatest value is our clients.¡± In early 2013, we
placed plaques engraved with the pledge of our employees at the entrance to every branch
nationwide. Samsung Securities is devoted to providing the best products and services for
our clients based on the principle of client-oriented management.
First, we provide comprehensive wealth management services, develop products optimized
to the needs of clients by using our advanced CRM system, and offer timely investment
information in a rapidly changing market. We will also improve the overall process of
financial products sales from development, sourcing, operation, and management to secure
competitiveness and prompt responses to a fluctuating market environment and rapidly
evolving client needs.
In the wholesale and IB businesses, we strive to improve the organization¡¯s overall health to
enhance our long term competitiveness by promoting collaborative marketing among business
divisions and focusing on providing sophisticated solutions to meet the investment needs of
institutional clients. This will all help us to grow into a market leader in the core M&A and IPO
businesses utilizing our top talents. Amendment to the Capital Markets Act will help us diversify
revenue sources and generate synergy with existing businesses by taking full advantage
of new opportunities like corporate lending and alternative trading system (ATS). We can
therefore position ourselves as a financial services company known for creating stable results,
while maximizing client satisfaction and profits.
As the first domestic financial company to be incorporated into the Dow Jones Sustainability
Index (DJSI) for three consecutive years, Samsung Securities will set the example for
the industry¡¯s sustainability management. First, we commit ourselves to creating a sound
organizational culture where everyone benefits from equal opportunities based on ¡°open
recruitment¡± and a fair HR management system, ensuring talented individuals can trust their
company and realize their full potential. We will also continue to support children and give
them hope through our signature CSR programs, such as Financial Academy for Children
and Dream Maru. Last, as the nation¡¯s top securities firm, we will lead the green and social
investment culture with products such as the ¡°Good Fund¡± and ¡°Green Fund¡± to spread financial
products that will take care of future generations.
Dear stakeholders,
We expect that a challenging market environment will continue for the foreseeable future.
Samsung Securities has a long-term outlook, however, instead of focusing on short-term
profits, with the spirit of Seoungpung Parang, which is an idiom that means ¡°withstanding
winds and waves with a far-reaching goal in mind¡±. We will lay the basis for sustainable
growth with client trust and integrity management to showcase our full potential with constant
innovation throughout all of our departments and divisions. Again, we will share with the
entire society as a trusted partner. All of us at Samsung Securities appreciate the continued
support and encouragement from our stakeholders
Thank you.

In 2013, we had to contend with recession amid continuing uncertainties in the world
economy such as slowing growth in China, the possibility of US tapering its quantitative
easing. The average daily trading value of South Korea¡¯s stock market fell to the KRW 5
trillion (half of its 2011 high), while the value of the domestic fund market remained stable
at 2007 pre-crisis level of KRW 330 trillion. More than a third of South Korean securities
brokers recorded losses and many were put up for sale.
Regardless of our effort to attract client assets and reduce expenses, FY 2013 net revenue
and net profit recorded KRW 557.9 billion and KRW 11.0 billion, respectively as brokerage
commission and bond sales dropped.
Despite this challenging environment, we firmly believe that corporate responsibility plays
a crucial role in our long-term success as a business and as a partner to our clients. We
therefore strive to incorporate social responsibilities into every aspect of our work and
maintain a prudent taking of risk in line with our strategic priorities.
Our social contribution activities, carried out by 123 volunteer teams across the country,
are designed to meet the needs of the communities in which we operate. We also increased
our caring and sharing projects, such as providing free retirement planning and
no-cost donation consulting services. These activities have proven to be a major means of
enhancing our leadership in the area of sustainable management. Last year, we became
the only company in the domestic financial industry to be confirmed as a member of Dow
Jones Sustainability Index World for the fourth consecutive year.
In 2014, despite a gradual recovery in the global economy, South Korea is likely to continue
experiencing low growth due to weak consumer demand and continued sluggishness
in the real estate sector.
We expect competition in the stock market to intensify as securities brokers increase their
focus on selling products on mobile platforms and trading-value growth remains low. The
introduction of fund supermarkets will also present challenges for the financial products
market, while the securities industry as a whole will likely see more alliances and mergers.We believe, however, that strongly capitalized banks with a clear and demonstrated client
focus will have a competitive advantage.
Here at Samsung Securities, client-oriented management remains our highest priority. We
will concentrate on building client trust by making dramatic innovations to our organizational
culture, business systems, and operating processes. These will include strengthening our
expertise in private banking, increasing head office assistance for clients, and enhancing
online systems and contents. These steps will help us secure a stable revenue base by
attracting new clients and increasing the value of their assets.
We will also focus on the implementation of our integrated bank strategy on increasing the
market share in wealth management and strengthening our competitiveness in future growth
drivers, such as corporate lending and prime brokerage.
In the face of stagnant markets, our integrated business model will adjust to achieve resilient
and sustainable long-term growth via continuing cost reduction and enhancing productivity
through process innovation.
We will also make efforts to provide the right developmental opportunities based on
individual and organizational needs for our employees. Besides prudent approach to
employee strategy, we firmly believe that corporate responsibility plays a crucial role in our
long-term success as a business. We therefore endeavor to incorporate our approach into
activities including ¡°Dream-maru,¡± an economy class for youth, and ¡°YAHO¡± community
service team.
Although we expect the market environment will remain uncertain in 2014, Samsung
Securities will do its utmost to maintain its position as the leading South Korean financial
player, committed to achieve strong, safe, and continuous growth that will ensure our clients¡¯
trust. Rather than to blame such a challenging environment, we will stay firm, facing the
future with a belief in the value of creativity, innovation, and confidence.
We would like to sincerely thank all our clients, shareholders, employees, and other
stakeholders at all levels for their exceptional contributions and continued support.
Yours sincerely,

In retrospect, Samsung Securities has fought harder than ever starting in 2014 to overcome
challenges posed by a delayed recovery of the securities business environment.
Emerging market crises, coupled with an abrupt plunge in oil prices, fanned uncertainties
and volatility last year in global financial markets. Simultaneously, the KOSPI sagged, despite
government stimuli, with its trading value staying near a low set in 2013.
Moreover, Korea¡¯s securities industry was undermined by crises affecting both the market and
sector credibility in the wake of capital flight over diminishing return on investments (ROI) and
inadequate after-sales services.
To meet these challenges, Samsung Securities addressed key client grievances to restore trustbased
relationships with clients by fundamentally changing its business practices. While
realigning its financial advice with client investment goals and providing thorough explanations
on investment specifications, we reviewed and then strengthened our procedures regarding the
monitoring of after-sales service practices.
As a result, our performance significantly improved last year over 2013, as the total value of
client assets under management (AUM) surged to KRW 136 trillion and net profit hit KRW 229.5
billion.
We also adhere to our basic principles of exhaustive risk management as we continue to fulfill
our corporate social responsibilities via social contribution programs.
Our certified information security control further bolstered client information protection practices,
and consistent efforts were made to save energy and resources as part of our commitment to
green management. As of last year, our signature CSR program, Youth Securities Academy, has
motivated over 160,000 students to acquire basic knowledge on economics.
In order to promote educational equality, we upgraded dilapidated facilities and equipment at 13
children¡¯s charities nationwide and continue to operate our afterschool program Dream Maru,
which specializes in children from low-income families.
In recognition of our consistent engagement with social and environmental issues and exemplary
sustainability management practices, Samsung Securities was included in DJSI World in 2014 for
a fifth year running, which is a first for a Korean financial firm.In retrospect, Samsung Securities has fought harder than ever starting in 2014 to overcome
challenges posed by a delayed recovery of the securities business environment.

Moreover, Korea¡¯s securities industry was undermined by crises affecting both the market and

To meet these challenges, Samsung Securities addressed key client grievances to restore trustbased

on investment specifications, we reviewed and then strengthened our procedures regarding the

As a result, our performance significantly improved last year over 2013, as the total value of
